div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In re Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus by Columbia George
Order Allowing U.S. to Intervene Filed MAR 26, 1906 Reeves Ayres, Clerk. By A. N. Moore, Deputy.
In the United States Circuit Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Columbia George, for a writ of habeas corpus. No. 1390.
Order Allowing the United States to Intervene and Answer and Defend.

On this 26th day of March 1906 comes Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and moves that the United States of America be given leave to intervene and answer the petition filed herein and the order to show cause issued thereon, and defend against the same; and the Court being fully advised in the premises, and all things here understood:

Now, Therefore, It is hereby ordered and adjudged that the United States of America be, and it hereby is, given leave to intervene and answer the petition filed herein and the order to show cause issued thereon, and defend against the same.
Done in open Court this 26th day of March 1906.
